job_title: Donor Center Coordinator in Louisville, KY
pros:
1) Very rewarding field to work in, as you have the opportunity to serve the community and facilitate donation operations.
2) Opportunity to work with unique, intelligent individuals. 
3) Generous bonuses and incentives to loyal employees--in the form of year-end-monetary bonuses, gift cards, etc. in response to high organizational productivity.
cons:
1) Upper management sometimes applies heavy pressure on employees without first appreciating their perspective or daily workload, which can fluctuate unexpectedly. This can easily be checked by referencing call volume and case load stats. 
2) Upper management could do better at reaching out to the lower ranks for suggestions on how to be more efficient, help the company be more productive, and be of better service to hospital staff and donor families.
3) In the past, staffing limitations prevented the recovery of donor tissue. In other words, Donor Center Coordinators were very busy and productive but we did not have the recovery team resources to successfully recover from all these donors. This was a source of repeated frustration for Donor Center Coordinators. The organization was in dire need of expanding its tissue recovery staff roster so that two tissue recovery teams could be available every shift. 
4) The organ teams had a bad habit of stealing tissue team staff to help with organ recoveries. This resulted in shifts where the tissue team on-call was totally unavailable. This is where a second on-call tissue team would be a major help in preserving Donor Center productivity and limiting the number of consented donations that we had to forgo simply due to staffing issues.

review_title: Dedicated and Compassionate People doing Life-changing work everyday
pros:
KODA is full of passionate, smart, fun individuals committed to this lifesaving mission.  I love being able to share my story of being a donor family - and have so many co-workers who have walked a similar journey.  Every day, you leave work knowing that you've had a hand in saving lives and supporting families through difficult times.  I have the honor to work with incredible people - donor families, recipients, hospitals, circuit clerks, volunteers, coroners, funeral homes, legislators, media and community leaders - to connect and inspire everyone to donate life.  

Welcoming people.  Great pay, office environment, and benefits.  Flexible schedule.  Passionate and supportive Board of Directors.
cons: This job requires great commitment and compassion.  It is not a place to go if all you want to do is punch a timecard.  These families, and this mission, stay in your mind & heart long after you "clock out".
